intro: Ozanonia freynii, commonly known as the Freyn's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, waxy leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Ozanonia freynii is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a unique ecological role in its native range, contributing to local biodiversity.
